jaakobah_660.name: Jaakobah
jaakobah_660.bio: Heel-catcher, a form of the name Jacob, one of the descendants of Simeon ([1 Chr. 4:36](/1chr#1Chr.4.36)).

jaala_661.name: Jaala
jaala_661.bio: A wild she-goat, one of the Nethinim, whose descendants returned from the Captivity ([Neh. 7:58](/neh#Neh.7.58)).

jaalam_662.name: Jaalam
jaalam_662.bio: Concealer, the second of Esau’s three sons by Aholibamah ([Gen. 36:5](/gen#Gen.36.5), [14](/gen#Gen.36.14)).

jaanai_663.name: Jaanai
jaanai_663.bio: Mourner, one of the chief Gadites ([1 Chr. 5:12](/1chr#1Chr.5.12)).

jaasiel_666.name: Jaasiel
jaasiel_666.bio: Made by God, one of David’s body-guard, the son of Abner ([1 Chr. 27:21](/1chr#1Chr.27.21)), called Jasiel in [1 Chr. 11:47](/1chr#1Chr.11.47).

jaazaniah_668.name: Jaazaniah (Rechabite)
jaazaniah_668.bio: The son of Jeremiah, and one of the chief Rechabites ([Jer. 35:3](/jer#Jer.35.3)).

jaazaniah_669.name: Jaazaniah (Officer in the army of the kingdom of Ju)

jaaziah_671.name: Jaaziah
jaaziah_671.bio: Comforted by Jehovah, a descendant of Merari the Levite ([1 Chr. 24:26](/1chr#1Chr.24.26), [27](/1chr#1Chr.24.27)).

jaaziel_672.name: Jaaziel
jaaziel_672.bio: Comforted by God, a Levitical musician ([1 Chr. 15:18](/1chr#1Chr.15.18)).

jabal_673.name: Jabal
jabal_673.bio: A stream, a descendant of Cain, and brother of Jubal; “the father of such as dwell in tents and have cattle” ([Gen. 4:20](/gen#Gen.4.20)). This description indicates that he led a wandering life.

jabesh_674.name: Jabesh
jabesh_674.bio: The father of Shallum ([2 Kings 15:10](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.10), [13](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.13), [14](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.14)), who usurped the throne of Israel on the death of Zachariah.

jabez_675.name: Jabez
jabez_675.bio: A descendant of Judah, of whom it is recorded that “God granted him that which he requested” ([1 Chr. 4:9](/1chr#1Chr.4.9), [10](/1chr#1Chr.4.10)).

jabin_676.name: Jabin (Hebrew: יָבִין Yāḇîn)
jabin_676.bio: A king of Hazor, at the time of the entrance of Israel into Canaan ([Josh. 11:1-14](/josh#Josh.11.1)), whose overthrow and that of the northern chief with whom he had entered into a confederacy against Joshua was the crowning act in the conquest of the land (11:21-23; comp. 14:6-15).

jabin_677.name: Jabin (king of Hazor)
jabin_677.bio: Another king of Hazor, called “the king of Canaan,” who overpowered the Israelites of the north one hundred and sixty years after Joshua’s death, and for twenty years held them in painful subjection. The whole population were paralyzed with fear, and gave way to hopeless despondency ([Judg. 5:6-11](/judg#Judg.5.6)), till Deborah and Barak aroused the national spirit, and gathering together ten thousand men, gained a great and decisive victory over Jabin in the plain of Esdraelon ([Judg.

jachan_678.name: Jachan
jachan_678.bio: Mourner, one of the chief Gadite “brothers” in Bashan ([1 Chr. 5:13](/1chr#1Chr.5.13)).

jachin_679.name: Jachin (Son of Simeon)
jachin_679.bio: The fourth son of Simeon ([Gen. 46:10](/gen#Gen.46.10)), called also Jarib ([1 Chr. 4:24](/1chr#1Chr.4.24)).

jachin_680.name: Jachin (Priest returned from exile)
jachin_680.bio: One of the priests who returned from the Exile ([1 Chr. 9:10](/1chr#1Chr.9.10)).

jachin_681.name: Jachin (Son of Simeon)
jachin_681.bio: The head of one of the courses (the twenty-first) of priests ([1 Chr. 24:17](/1chr#1Chr.24.17)).

jaddua_686.name: Jaddua (the son of Hakaliah)
jaddua_686.bio: One of the chiefs who subscribed the covenant ([Neh. 10:21](/neh#Neh.10.21)).

jaddua_687.name: Jaddua (family head of Levites)
jaddua_687.bio: The last high priest mentioned in the Old Testament ([Neh. 12:11](/neh#Neh.12.11), [22](/neh#Neh.12.22)), sons of Jonathan.

jadon_688.name: Jadon
jadon_688.bio: Judge, a Meronothite who assisted in rebuilding the walls of Jerusalem ([Neh. 3:7](/neh#Neh.3.7)).

jael_689.name: Jael
jael_689.bio: Mountain-goat, the wife of Heber the Kenite ([Judg. 4:17-22](/judg#Judg.4.17)). When the Canaanites were defeated by Barak, Sisera, the captain of Jabin’s army, fled and sought refuge with the friendly tribe of Heber, beneath the oaks of Zaanaim.

jahath_692.name: Jahath (Ziza)
jahath_692.bio: A son of Shimei, and grandson of Gershom ([1 Chr. 23:10](/1chr#1Chr.23.10)).

jahath_693.name: Jahath (Grandson of Judah)
jahath_693.bio: One of the sons of Shelomoth, of the family of Kohath ([1 Chr. 24:22](/1chr#1Chr.24.22)).

jahath_694.name: Jahath (Levite in charge of laborers)
jahath_694.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari, one of the overseers of the repairs of the temple under Josiah ([2 Chr. 34:12](/2chr#2Chr.34.12)).

jahaziel_697.name: Jahaziel (the Priest)
jahaziel_697.bio: A priest who accompanied the removal of the ark to Jerusalem ([1 Chr. 16:6](/1chr#1Chr.16.6)).

jahaziel_698.name: Jahaziel (son of Hebron)
jahaziel_698.bio: The third son of Hebron ([1 Chr. 23:19](/1chr#1Chr.23.19)).

jahaziel_699.name: Jahaziel (the Levite)
jahaziel_699.bio: The son of Zechariah, a Levite of the family of Asaph ([2 Chr. 20:14-17](/2chr#2Chr.20.14)). He encouraged Jehoshaphat against the Moabites and Ammonites.

jahdai_701.name: Jahdai
jahdai_701.bio: Grasper, a descendant of Caleb, of the family of Hezron ([1 Chr. 2:47](/1chr#1Chr.2.47)).

jahzeel_706.name: Jahzeel
jahzeel_706.bio: Allotted by God, the first of the sons of Naphtali ([Gen. 46:24](/gen#Gen.46.24)).

jahzerah_707.name: Jahzerah
jahzerah_707.bio: Returner, the son of Meshullam, and father of Adiel ([1 Chr. 9:12](/1chr#1Chr.9.12)).

jair_664.name: Jair (the 8th Judge of Israel)
jair_664.bio: The father of Elhanan, who slew Lahmi, the brother of Goliath ([1 Chr. 20:5](/1chr#1Chr.20.5)).

jair_708.name: Jair (the son of Segub of the tribe of Judah –)

jair_710.name: Jair (Bashan the villages)
jair_710.bio: A Benjamite, the father of Mordecai, Esther’s uncle ([Esther 2:5](/esth#Esth.2.5)).

jairus_711.name: Jairus
jairus_711.bio: A ruler of the synagogue at Capernaum, whose only daughter Jesus restored to life ([Mark 5:22](/mark#Mark.5.22); [Luke 8:41](/luke#Luke.8.41)). Entering into the chamber of death, accompanied by Peter and James and John and the father and mother of the maiden, he went forward to the bed whereon the corpse lay, and said, Talitha cumi, i.e., “Maid, arise,” and immediately the spirit of the maiden came to her again, and she arose straightway; and “at once to strengthen that life which had come back to her, and to prove that she was indeed no ghost, but had returned to the realities of a mortal existence, he commanded to give her something to eat” ([Mark 5:43](/mark#Mark.5.43)).

jakeh_712.name: Jakeh
jakeh_712.bio: Pious, the father of Agur ([Prov. 30:1](/prov#Prov.30.1)). Nothing is known of him.

jakim_714.name: Jakim (Chief of the twelfth priestly order)
jakim_714.bio: Chief of the twelfth priestly order ([1 Chr. 24:12](/1chr#1Chr.24.12)).

jalon_715.name: Jalon
jalon_715.bio: Lodger, the last of the four sons of Ezra, of the tribe of Judah ([1 Chr. 4:17](/1chr#1Chr.4.17)).

jambres_716.name: Jambres
jambres_716.bio: One of those who opposed Moses in Egypt ([2 Tim. 3:8](/2tim#2Tim.3.8)).

james_717.name: James (The first of the general)
james_717.bio: The son of Zebedee and Salome; an elder brother of John the apostle. He was one of the twelve. He was by trade a fisherman, in partnership with Peter ( Matthew 20:20 ; 27:56 ).

james_718.name: James (son of Alphaeus)
james_718.bio: The son of Alphaeus, or Cleopas, "the brother" or near kinsman or cousin of our Lord ( Galatians 1:18 Galatians 1:19 ), called James "the Less," or "the Little," probably because he was of low stature. He is mentioned along with the other apostles ( Matthew 10:3 ; Mark 3:18 ; Luke 6:15 ). He had a separate interview with our Lord after his resurrection ( 1�Corinthians 15:7 ), and is mentioned as one of the apostles of the circumcision ( Acts 1:13 ).

james_719.name: James (son of Zebedee)
james_719.bio: The son of Alphaeus, or Cleopas, "the brother" or near kinsman or cousin of our Lord ( Galatians 1:18 Galatians 1:19 ), called James "the Less," or "the Little," probably because he was of low stature. He is mentioned along with the other apostles ( Matthew 10:3 ; Mark 3:18 ; Luke 6:15 ). He had a separate interview with our Lord after his resurrection ( 1�Corinthians 15:7 ), and is mentioned as one of the apostles of the circumcision ( Acts 1:13 ).

jamin_722.name: Jamin (post exile levite who interpreted the la)

jannes_725.name: Jannes
jannes_725.bio: One of the Egyptians who “withstood Moses” ([2 Tim. 3:8](/2tim#2Tim.3.8)).

japheth_726.name: Japheth
japheth_726.bio: Wide spreading: “God shall enlarge Japheth” (Heb. Yaphat Elohim le-Yephet, [Gen. 9:27](/gen#Gen.9.27).

japhia_727.name: Japhia (king of Lachish)
japhia_727.bio: The king of Lachish, who joined in the confederacy against Joshua ([Josh. 10:3](/josh#Josh.10.3)), and was defeated and slain. In one of the Amarna tablets he speaks of himself as king of Gezer.

japhia_728.name: Japhia (son of David)
japhia_728.bio: One of the sons of David ([2 Sam. 5:15](/2sam#2Sam.5.15)), born in Jerusalem.

jared_730.name: Jared
jared_730.bio: The fourth antediluvian patriarch in descent from Seth ([Gen. 5:15-20](/gen#Gen.5.15); [Luke 3:37](/luke#Luke.3.37)), the father of Enoch; called Jered in [1 Chr. 1:2](/1chr#1Chr.1.2).

jarib_733.name: Jarib (A son of Simeon)
jarib_733.bio: One of the chiefs sent by Ezra to bring up the priests to Jerusalem ([Ezra 8:16](/ezra#Ezra.8.16)).

jarib_734.name: Jarib (18And among the sons of the priests ther)

jashen_736.name: Jashen
jashen_736.bio: Sleeping, called also Hashem ([1 Chr. 11:34](/1chr#1Chr.11.34)); a person, several of whose sons were in David’s body-guard ([2 Sam. 23:32](/2sam#2Sam.23.32)).

jasher_737.name: Jasher
jasher_737.bio: Upright. “The Book of Jasher,” rendered in the LXX. “the Book of the Upright One,” by the Vulgate “the Book of Just Ones,” was probably a kind of national sacred song-book, a collection of songs in praise of the heroes of Israel, a “book of golden deeds,” a national anthology.

jashobeam_738.name: Jashobeam (a chief officer and Hakmonite)
jashobeam_738.bio: Dweller among the people; or to whom the people turn, the Hachmonite ([1 Chr. 11:11](/1chr#1Chr.11.11)), one of David’s chief heroes who joined him at Ziklag (12:6). He was the first of the three who broke through the host of the Philistines to fetch water to David from the well of Bethlehem ([2 Sam.

jashobeam_739.name: Jashobeam (this is the list of David’s mighty warri)

jashub_1638.name: Jashub (son of Issachar)
jashub_1638.bio: The third of Issachar’s four sons ([1 Chr. 7:1](/1chr#1Chr.7.1)); called also Job ([Gen. 46:13](/gen#Gen.46.13)).

jason_742.name: Jason
jason_742.bio: he that will cure, the host of Paul and Silas in Thessalonica. The Jews assaulted his house in order to seize Paul, but failing to find him, they dragged Jason before the ruler of the city ( Acts 17:5-9 ). He was apparently one of the kinsmen of Paul ( Romans 16:21 ), and accompanied him from Thessalonica to Corinth.

javan_744.name: Javan
javan_744.bio: The fourth “son” of Japheth ([Gen. 10:2](/gen#Gen.10.2)), whose descendants settled in Greece, i.e., Ionia, which bears the name of Javan in Hebrew. Alexander the Great is called the “king of Javan” (rendered “Grecia,” [Dan.

jebusite_748.name: Jebusite
jebusite_748.bio: The name of the original inhabitants of Jebus, mentioned frequently among the seven nations doomed to destruction ([Gen. 10:16](/gen#Gen.10.16); [15:21](/gen#Gen.15.21); [Ex. 3:8](/exod#Exod.3.8), [17](/exod#Exod.3.17); 13:5, etc.).

jecoliah_750.name: Jecoliah
jecoliah_750.bio: Able through Jehovah, the wife of King Amaziah, and mother of King Uzziah ([2 Chr. 26:3](/2chr#2Chr.26.3)).

jedaiah_751.name: Jedaiah (Invoker of Jehovah. The son of Shimri)
jedaiah_751.bio: Invoker of Jehovah. The son of Shimri, a chief Simeonite ([1 Chr. 4:37](/1chr#1Chr.4.37)).

jedaiah_752.name: Jedaiah (son of Joiarib)
jedaiah_752.bio: A priest in Jerusalem after the Exile ([1 Chr. 9:10](/1chr#1Chr.9.10)).

jedaiah_753.name: Jedaiah (priest of ancient Israel)
jedaiah_753.bio: Knowing Jehovah. The chief of one of the courses of the priests ([1 Chr. 24:7](/1chr#1Chr.24.7)).

jedaiah_754.name: Jedaiah (Adjoining this)
jedaiah_754.bio: One of those who repaired the walls of Jerusalem after the return from Babylon ([Neh. 3:10](/neh#Neh.3.10)).

jediael_757.name: Jediael (sons of Benjamin)
jediael_757.bio: One of the sons of Benjamin, whose descendants numbered 17,200 warriors ([1 Chr. 7:6](/1chr#1Chr.7.6), [10](/1chr#1Chr.7.10), [11](/1chr#1Chr.7.11)).

jediael_758.name: Jediael (son of Benjamin)
jediael_758.bio: A Shimrite, one of David’s bodyguard ([1 Chr. 11:45](/1chr#1Chr.11.45)). Probably same as in 12:20.

jediael_760.name: Jediael (Concerning the divisions of the gatekeep)
jediael_760.bio: A Korhite of the family of Ebiasaph, and one of the gate-keepers to the temple ([1 Chr. 26:2](/1chr#1Chr.26.2)).

jeduthun_1224.name: Jeduthun (psalm of David)
jeduthun_1224.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari, one of the leaders of the temple music ([1 Chr. 6:44](/1chr#1Chr.6.44); [15:17](/1chr#1Chr.15.17), [19](/1chr#1Chr.15.19)). He was probably the same as Jeduthun.

jehalelel_765.name: Jehalelel
jehalelel_765.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari ([2 Chr. 29:12](/2chr#2Chr.29.12)).

jehdeiah_766.name: Jehdeiah (descendant of Shubael)
jehdeiah_766.bio: One of the Levitical attendants at the temple, a descendant of Shubael ([1 Chr. 24:20](/1chr#1Chr.24.20)).

jehdeiah_767.name: Jehdeiah (herdsman of the asses under David and So)
jehdeiah_767.bio: A Meronothite, herdsman of the asses under David and Solomon ([1 Chr. 27:30](/1chr#1Chr.27.30)).

jehiel_770.name: Jehiel (David's guard)
jehiel_770.bio: One of the Levites “of the second degree,” appointed to conduct the music on the occasion of the ark’s being removed to Jerusalem ([1 Chr. 15:18](/1chr#1Chr.15.18), [20](/1chr#1Chr.15.20)).

jehiel_772.name: Jehiel (A companion of Davids sons)
jehiel_772.bio: A Hachmonite, a tutor in the family of David toward the close of his reign ([1 Chr. 27:32](/1chr#1Chr.27.32)).

jehiel_773.name: Jehiel (described as jehoshaphat's son in the bi)
jehiel_773.bio: The second of Jehoshaphat’s six sons ([2 Chr. 21:2](/2chr#2Chr.21.2)).

jehiel_774.name: Jehiel (Son of Heman)
jehiel_774.bio: One of the Levites of the family of Heman who assisted Hezekiah in his work of reformation ([2 Chr. 29:14](/2chr#2Chr.29.14)).

jehiel_776.name: Jehiel (one of the Levite rulers of the house of)
jehiel_776.bio: A “prince” and “ruler of the house of God” who contributed liberally to the renewal of the temple sacrifices under Josiah ([2 Chr. 35:8](/2chr#2Chr.35.8)).

jehizkiah_781.name: Jehizkiah
jehizkiah_781.bio: Jehovah strengthens, one of the chiefs of Ephraim ([2 Chr. 28:12](/2chr#2Chr.28.12)).

jehoaddan_783.name: Jehoaddan
jehoaddan_783.bio: Jehovah his ornament, the wife of King Jehoash, and mother of King Amaziah ([2 Kings 14:2](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.2)).

jehoahaz_784.name: Jehoahaz (father of Jehoahaz)
jehoahaz_784.bio: The son and successor of Jehu, king of Israel ([2 Kings 10:35](/2kgs#2Kgs.10.35)). He reigned seventeen years, and followed the evil ways of the house of Jeroboam. The Syrians, under Hazael and Benhadad, prevailed over him, but were at length driven out of the land by his son Jehoash (13:1-9, 25).

jehoahaz_2516.name: Jehoahaz (Son of Jehu and King of Israel in Samari)
jehoahaz_2516.bio: A son of king Josiah ([1 Chr. 3:15](/1chr#1Chr.3.15); [Jer. 22:11](/jer#Jer.22.11)), who was elected to succeed his father on the throne, although he was two years younger than his brother Eliakim.

jehohanan_785.name: Jehohanan (sixth and Eliehoenai)
jehohanan_785.bio: A Korhite, the head of one of the divisions of the temple porters ([1 Chr. 26:3](/1chr#1Chr.26.3)).

jehoiachin_791.name: Jehoiachin
jehoiachin_791.bio: Succeeded his father Jehoiakin (B.C. 599) when only eight years of age, and reigned for one hundred days ([2 Chr. 36:9](/2chr#2Chr.36.9)).

jehoiada_792.name: Jehoiada (father of Benaiah)
jehoiada_792.bio: The father of Benaiah, who was one of David’s chief warriors ([2 Sam. 8:18](/2sam#2Sam.8.18); [20:23](/2sam#2Sam.20.23)).

jehoiada_793.name: Jehoiada (the priest)
jehoiada_793.bio: The high priest at the time of Athaliah’s usurpation of the throne of Judah. He married Jehosheba, or Jehoshabeath, the daughter of king Jehoram ([2 Chr. 22:11](/2chr#2Chr.22.11)), and took an active part along with his wife in the preservation and training of Jehoash when Athaliah slew all the royal family of Judah.

jehoiakim_1085.name: Jehoiakim
jehoiakim_1085.bio: He whom Jehovah has set up, the second son of Josiah, and eighteenth king of Judah, which he ruled over for eleven years (B.C. 610-599). His original name was Eliakim (q.v.).

jehoiarib_798.name: Jehoiarib
jehoiarib_798.bio: Jehovah defends, a priest at Jerusalem, head of one of the sacerdotal courses ([1 Chr. 9:10](/1chr#1Chr.9.10); [24:7](/1chr#1Chr.24.7)). His “course” went up from Babylon after the Exile ([Ezra 2:36-39](/ezra#Ezra.2.36); [Neh.

jehonathan_800.name: Jehonathan (The son of Uzziah)
jehonathan_800.bio: One of the stewards of David’s store-houses ([1 Chr. 27:25](/1chr#1Chr.27.25)).

jehonathan_801.name: Jehonathan (The Steward)
jehonathan_801.bio: A Levite who taught the law to the people of Judah ([2 Chr. 17:8](/2chr#2Chr.17.8)).

jehoram_803.name: Jehoram (of Judah or Joram)
jehoram_803.bio: The eldest son and successor of Jehoshaphat, king of Judah. He reigned eight years (B.C. 892-885) alone as king of Judah, having been previously for some years associated with his father ([2 Chr.

jehoram_805.name: Jehoram (the priest)
jehoram_805.bio: A priest sent by Jehoshaphat to instructruct the people in Judah ([2 Chr. 17:8](/2chr#2Chr.17.8)).

jehoshabeath_811.name: Jehoshabeath
jehoshabeath_811.bio: Jehovah-swearing, the daughter of Jehoram, the king of Israel. She is called Jehoshabeath in [2 Chr. 22:11](/2chr#2Chr.22.11).

jehoshaphat_806.name: Jehoshaphat (the Recorder)
jehoshaphat_806.bio: Son of Ahilud, “recorder” or annalist under David and Solomon ([2 Sam. 8:16](/2sam#2Sam.8.16)), a state officer of high rank, chancellor or vizier of the kingdom.

jehoshaphat_808.name: Jehoshaphat (according to 1 Kings 15:24)
jehoshaphat_808.bio: The son and successor of Asa, king of Judah. After fortifying his kingdom against Israel ([2 Chr. 17:1](/2chr#2Chr.17.1), [2](/2chr#2Chr.17.2)), he set himself to cleanse the land of idolatry ([1 Kings 22:43](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.43)).

jehoshaphat_809.name: Jehoshaphat (Nimshi)
jehoshaphat_809.bio: The son of Nimshi, and father of Jehu, king of Israel ([2 Kings 9:2](/2kgs#2Kgs.9.2), [14](/2kgs#2Kgs.9.14)).

jehoshaphat_810.name: Jehoshaphat (son of David)
jehoshaphat_810.bio: One of the priests who accompanied the removal of the ark to Jerusalem ([1 Chr. 15:24](/1chr#1Chr.15.24)).

jehozabad_812.name: Jehozabad (assassins of King Jehoash)
jehozabad_812.bio: The son of Shomer, one of the two conspirators who put king Jehoash to death in Millo in Jerusalem ([2 Kings 12:21](/2kgs#2Kgs.12.21)).

jehozabad_813.name: Jehozabad (Son of Shimei)
jehozabad_813.bio: The son of Obed-edom ([1 Chr. 26:4](/1chr#1Chr.26.4)), one of the Levite porters.

jehu_816.name: Jehu (the seer)
jehu_816.bio: The son of Hanani, a prophet of Judah ([1 Kings 16:1](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.1), [7](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.7); [2 Chr. 19:2](/2chr#2Chr.19.2); [20:34](/2chr#2Chr.20.34)), who pronounced the sentence of God against Baasha, the king of Israel.

jehu_817.name: Jehu (son of Jehoshaphat)
jehu_817.bio: King of Israel, the son of Jehoshaphat ([2 Kings 9:2](/2kgs#2Kgs.9.2)), and grandson of Nimshi. The story of his exaltation to the throne is deeply interesting. During the progress of a war against the Syrians, who were becoming more and more troublesome to Israel, in a battle at Ramoth-gilead Jehoram, the king of Israel, had been wounded; and leaving his army there, had returned to Jezreel, whither his ally, Ahaziah, king of Judah, had also gone on a visit of sympathy with him ([2 Kings 8:28](/2kgs#2Kgs.8.28), [29](/2kgs#2Kgs.8.29)).

jehu_818.name: Jehu (the tenth king.)
jehu_818.bio: The son of Obed, and father of Azariah ([1 Chr. 2:38](/1chr#1Chr.2.38)).

jehu_819.name: Jehu (A Simeonite prince during the reign of H)

jehu_820.name: Jehu (Saul's Kinsman)
jehu_820.bio: One of the Benjamite slingers that joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:3](/1chr#1Chr.12.3)).

jehudi_823.name: Jehudi
jehudi_823.bio: A Jew, son of Nethaniah. He was sent by the princes to invite Baruch to read Jeremiah’s roll to them ([Jer. 36:14](/jer#Jer.36.14), [21](/jer#Jer.36.21)).

jeiel_827.name: Jeiel (and Azaziah were to play the harps)
jeiel_827.bio: One of the Levites who took part in praising God on the removal of the ark to Jerusalem ([1 Chr. 16:5](/1chr#1Chr.16.5)).

jeiel_830.name: Jeiel (son of Elizaphan)
jeiel_830.bio: [2 Chr. 29:13](/2chr#2Chr.29.13). A Levite of the sons of Asaph.

jeiel_831.name: Jeiel (chief of the Levites)
jeiel_831.bio: One of the chief Levites, who made an offering for the restoration of the Passover by Josiah ([2 Chr. 35:9](/2chr#2Chr.35.9)).

jemima_837.name: Jemima
jemima_837.bio: Dove, the eldest of Job’s three daughters born after his time of trial ([Job 42:14](/job#Job.42.14)).

jemuel_838.name: Jemuel
jemuel_838.bio: One of Simeon’s five sons ([1 Chr. 4:24](/1chr#1Chr.4.24)), called also Jemuel ([Gen. 46:10](/gen#Gen.46.10)).

jephthah_839.name: Jephthah
jephthah_839.bio: Whom God sets free, or the breaker through, a “mighty man of valour” who delivered Israel from the oppression of the Ammonites ([Judg. 11:1-33](/judg#Judg.11.1)), and judged Israel six years (12:7). He has been described as “a wild, daring, Gilead mountaineer, a sort of warrior Elijah.” After forty-five years of comparative quiet Israel again apostatized, and in “process of time the children of Ammon made war against Israel” (11:5).

jephunneh_840.name: Jephunneh (son of Judah Caleb)
jephunneh_840.bio: The father of Caleb, who was Joshua’s companion in exploring Canaan ([Num. 13:6](/num#Num.13.6)), a Kenezite ([Josh. 14:14](/josh#Josh.14.14)).

jephunneh_841.name: Jephunneh (Kenizzite)
jephunneh_841.bio: One of the descendants of Asher ([1 Chr. 7:38](/1chr#1Chr.7.38)).

jerahmeel_843.name: Jerahmeel (The name Jerahmeel (Hebrew יְרַחְמְאֵל)
jerahmeel_843.bio: The son of Hezron, the brother of Caleb ([1 Chr. 2:9](/1chr#1Chr.2.9), [25](/1chr#1Chr.2.25), [26](/1chr#1Chr.2.26), etc.).

jerahmeel_844.name: Jerahmeel (Son of Kish)
jerahmeel_844.bio: The son of Kish, a Levite ([1 Chr. 24:29](/1chr#1Chr.24.29)).

jered_846.name: Jered
jered_846.bio: A son of Ezra probably ([1 Chr. 4:18](/1chr#1Chr.4.18)).

jeremiah_848.name: Jeremiah (Prophets)
jeremiah_848.bio: The father of Hamutal ([2 Kings 23:31](/2kgs#2Kgs.23.31)), the wife of Josiah.

jeremiah_849.name: Jeremiah (Weeping prophet)
jeremiah_849.bio: One of the chiefs of the tribe of Manasseh on the east of Jordan ([1 Chr. 5:24](/1chr#1Chr.5.24)).

jeremiah_850.name: Jeremiah (Jewish priest)
jeremiah_850.bio: A Benjamite slinger who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:4](/1chr#1Chr.12.4)).

jeremiah_851.name: Jeremiah (The brave of David)
jeremiah_851.bio: A Gadite who joined David in the wilderness ([1 Chr. 12:10](/1chr#1Chr.12.10)).

jeremiah_853.name: Jeremiah (The Prophet)
jeremiah_853.bio: One of the “greater prophets” of the Old Testament, son of Hilkiah (q.v.), a priest of Anathoth ([Jer. 1:1](/jer#Jer.1.1); [32:6](/jer#Jer.32.6)). He was called to the prophetical office when still young (1:6), in the thirteenth year of Josiah (B.C.

jeremoth_858.name: Jeremoth (One of the sons of Elam)

jerimoth_864.name: Jerimoth (name of eight men)
jerimoth_864.bio: One of the sons of Bela ([1 Chr. 7:7](/1chr#1Chr.7.7)).

jerimoth_866.name: Jerimoth (the name of eight men)
jerimoth_866.bio: A Benjamite slinger who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:5](/1chr#1Chr.12.5)).

jerimoth_867.name: Jerimoth (descendant of Heman)
jerimoth_867.bio: A Levitical musician under Heman his father ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4)).

jerimoth_870.name: Jerimoth (were assistants of Konaniah and Shimei h)
jerimoth_870.bio: A Levite, one of the overseers of the temple offerings ([2 Chr. 31:13](/2chr#2Chr.31.13)) in the reign of Hezekiah.

jeroboam_872.name: Jeroboam (the son of Nebat)
jeroboam_872.bio: The son of Nebat ([1 Kings 11:26-39](/1kgs#1Kgs.11.26)), “an Ephrathite,” the first king of the ten tribes, over whom he reigned twenty-two years (B.C. 976-945). He was the son of a widow of Zereda, and while still young was promoted by Solomon to be chief superintendent of the “burnden”, i.e., of the bands of forced labourers.

jeroboam_873.name: Jeroboam (King of Israel)
jeroboam_873.bio: Jeroboam II., the son and successor of Jehoash, and the fourteenth king of Israel, over which he ruled for forty-one years, B.C. 825-784 ([2 Kings 14:23](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.23)). He followed the example of the first Jeroboam in keeping up the worship of the golden calves ([2 Kings 14:24](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.24)).

jeroham_874.name: Jeroham (Levite)
jeroham_874.bio: Father of Elkanah, and grandfather of the prophet Samuel ([1 Sam. 1:1](/1sam#1Sam.1.1)).

jeroham_877.name: Jeroham (Adaiah son of Jeroham)
jeroham_877.bio: [1 Chr. 9:12](/1chr#1Chr.9.12); a priest, perhaps the same as in [Neh. 11:12](/neh#Neh.11.12).

jeroham_879.name: Jeroham (over Dan: Azarel son of Jeroham. These w)
jeroham_879.bio: The father of Azareel, the “captain” of the tribe of Dan ([1 Chr. 27:22](/1chr#1Chr.27.22)).

jeroham_880.name: Jeroham (Father of Azariah)
jeroham_880.bio: [2 Chr. 23:1](/2chr#2Chr.23.1); one whose son assisted in placing Joash on the throne.

jerubbesheth_881.name: Jerubbesheth
jerubbesheth_881.bio: Contender with the shame; i.e., idol, a surname also of Gideon ([2 Sam. 11:21](/2sam#2Sam.11.21)).

jerushah_882.name: Jerushah
jerushah_882.bio: Possession, or possessed; i.e., “by a husband”, the wife of Uzziah, and mother of king Jotham ([2 Kings 15:33](/2kgs#2Kgs.15.33)).

jesaiah_883.name: Jesaiah (son of Hananiah)
jesaiah_883.bio: One of the three sons of Hananiah ([1 Chr. 3:21](/1chr#1Chr.3.21)).

jesaiah_884.name: Jesaiah (Son of Hananiah; tribe of Judah)

jeshaiah_647.name: Jeshaiah (A Levite in the reign of David)
jeshaiah_647.bio: A Kohathite Levite, the father of Joram, of the family of Eliezer ([1 Chr. 26:25](/1chr#1Chr.26.25)); called also Isshiah (24:21).

jeshaiah_885.name: Jeshaiah (Musician of David)
jeshaiah_885.bio: One of the sons of Jeduthum ([1 Chr. 25:3](/1chr#1Chr.25.3), [15](/1chr#1Chr.25.15)).

jesharelah_334.name: Jesharelah
jesharelah_334.bio: Upright towards God, the head of the seventh division of Levitical musicians ([1 Chr. 25:14](/1chr#1Chr.25.14)).

jeshebeab_888.name: Jeshebeab
jeshebeab_888.bio: Seat of his father, the head of the fourteenth division of priests ([1 Chr. 24:13](/1chr#1Chr.24.13)).

jesher_889.name: Jesher
jesher_889.bio: Uprightness, the first of the three sons of Caleb by Azubah ([1 Chr. 2:18](/1chr#1Chr.2.18)).

jeshua_892.name: Jeshua (the Israelites)
jeshua_892.bio: A Levite appointed by Hezekiah to distribute offerings in the priestly cities ([2 Chr. 31:15](/2chr#2Chr.31.15)).

jeshua_899.name: Jeshua (High priest of the Jews)
jeshua_899.bio: Head of the ninth priestly order ([Ezra 2:36](/ezra#Ezra.2.36)); called also Jeshuah ([1 Chr. 24:11](/1chr#1Chr.24.11)).

jesse_903.name: Jesse
jesse_903.bio: firm, or a gift, a son of Obed, the son of Boaz and Ruth ( Ruth 4:17 Ruth 4:22 ; Matthew 1:5 Matthew 1:6 ; Luke 3:32 ). He was the father of eight sons, the youngest of whom was David ( 1�Samuel 17:12 ). The phrase "stem of Jesse" is used for the family of David ( Isaiah 11:1 ), and "root of Jesse" for the Messiah ( Isaiah 11:10 ; Revelation 5:5 ).

jesus_904.name: Jesus (Son of God)
jesus_904.bio: A Jewish Christian surnamed Justus ([Col. 4:11](/col#Col.4.11)). Je’sus, the proper, as Christ is the official, name of our Lord.

jesus_905.name: Jesus (Son of God)
jesus_905.bio: anointed, the Greek translation of the Hebrew word rendered "Messiah" (q.v.), the official title of our Lord, occurring five hundred and fourteen times in the New Testament. It denotes that he was anointed or consecrated to his great redemptive work as Prophet, Priest, and King of his people. He is Jesus the Christ ( Acts 17:3 ; 18:5 ; Matthew 22:42 ), the Anointed One.

jether_906.name: Jether (Turning)
jether_906.bio: The oldest of Gideon’s seventy sons ([Judg. 8:20](/judg#Judg.8.20)).

jether_907.name: Jether (son of Ner)
jether_907.bio: The father of Amasa, David’s general ([1 Kings 2:5](/1kgs#1Kgs.2.5), [32](/1kgs#1Kgs.2.32)); called Ithra ([2 Sam. 17:25](/2sam#2Sam.17.25)).

jetheth_910.name: Jetheth
jetheth_910.bio: A peg, or a prince, one of the Edomitish kings of Mount Seir ([Gen. 36:40](/gen#Gen.36.40)).

jetur_911.name: Jetur
jetur_911.bio: An enclosure, one of the twelve sons of Ishmael ([Gen. 25:15](/gen#Gen.25.15)).

jeuel_912.name: Jeuel
jeuel_912.bio: Snatched away by God, a descendant of Zerah ([1 Chr. 9:6](/1chr#1Chr.9.6)).

jeush_913.name: Jeush (assembler)
jeush_913.bio: The oldest of Esau’s three sons by Aholibamah ([Gen. 36:5](/gen#Gen.36.5), [14](/gen#Gen.36.14), [18](/gen#Gen.36.18)).

jeush_1601.name: Jeush (son of Bilhan)
jeush_1601.bio: A son of Bilhan, grandson of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 7:10](/1chr#1Chr.7.10)).

jeush_1602.name: Jeush (who did not have many sons)
jeush_1602.bio: A Levite, one of the sons of Shimei ([1 Chr. 23:10](/1chr#1Chr.23.10), [11](/1chr#1Chr.23.11)).

jeush_1603.name: Jeush (Son of Rehoboam)
jeush_1603.bio: One of the three sons of Rehoboam ([2 Chr. 11:19](/2chr#2Chr.11.19)).

jezaniah_667.name: Jezaniah
jezaniah_667.bio: A Maachathite ([2 Kings 25:23](/2kgs#2Kgs.25.23); [Jer. 40:8](/jer#Jer.40.8); [42:1](/jer#Jer.42.1)). He is also called Azariah ([Jer.

jezebel_1605.name: Jezebel
jezebel_1605.bio: Chaste, the daughter of Ethbaal, the king of the Zidonians, and the wife of Ahab, the king of Israel ([1 Kings 16:31](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.31)). This was the “first time that a king of Israel had allied himself by marriage with a heathen princess; and the alliance was in this case of a peculiarly disastrous kind. Jezebel has stamped her name on history as the representative of all that is designing, crafty, malicious, revengeful, and cruel.

jeziel_1608.name: Jeziel
jeziel_1608.bio: Assembled by God, a son of Azmaveth. He was one of the Benjamite archers who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:3](/1chr#1Chr.12.3)).

joab_1617.name: Joab (on of Zeruiah)
joab_1617.bio: One of the three sons of Zeruiah, David’s sister, and “captain of the host” during the whole of David’s reign ([2 Sam. 2:13](/2sam#2Sam.2.13); [10:7](/2sam#2Sam.10.7); [11:1](/2sam#2Sam.11.1); [1 Kings 11:15](/1kgs#1Kgs.11.15)). His father’s name is nowhere mentioned, although his sepulchre at Bethlehem is mentioned ([2 Sam.

joah_1621.name: Joah (chronicler to King Hezekiah)
joah_1621.bio: The son of Asaph, and “recorder” (q.v.) or chronicler to King Hezekiah ([2 Kings 18:18](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.18), [26](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.26), [37](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.37)).

joah_1623.name: Joah (son of Asaph)
joah_1623.bio: One of the sons of Obed-edom ([1 Chr. 26:4](/1chr#1Chr.26.4)), a Korhite porter.

joah_1626.name: Joah (Yahu is his brother)
joah_1626.bio: Son of Joahaz, and “recorder” (q.v.) or keeper of the state archives under King Josiah ([2 Chr. 34:8](/2chr#2Chr.34.8)).

joahaz_1627.name: Joahaz
joahaz_1627.bio: ([2 Chr. 34:8](/2chr#2Chr.34.8)), a contracted form of Jehoahaz (q.v.).

joanna_1628.name: Joanna (the wife of Chuza)
joanna_1628.bio: The grandson of Zerubbabel, in the lineage of Christ ([Luke 3:27](/luke#Luke.3.27)); the same as Hananiah ([1 Chr. 3:19](/1chr#1Chr.3.19)).

joanna_1629.name: Joanna (wife of Chuza)
joanna_1629.bio: The wife of Chuza, the steward of Herod Antipas, tetrarch of Galilee ([Luke 8:3](/luke#Luke.8.3)). She was one of the women who ministered to our Lord, and to whom he appeared after his resurrection ([Luke 8:3](/luke#Luke.8.3); [24:10](/luke#Luke.24.10)).

joash_1630.name: Joash (after Creation)
joash_1630.bio: A contracted form of Jehoash, the father of Gideon ([Judg. 6:11](/judg#Judg.6.11), [29](/judg#Judg.6.29); 8:13, 29, 32).

joash_1631.name: Joash (King of Israel)
joash_1631.bio: One of King Ahab’s sons ([1 Kings 22:26](/1kgs#1Kgs.22.26)).

joash_1632.name: Joash (Ahaziah)
joash_1632.bio: The son of King Ahaziah. While yet an infant, he was saved from the general massacre of the family by his aunt Jehosheba, and was apparently the only surviving descendant of Solomon ([2 Chr. 21:4](/2chr#2Chr.21.4), [17](/2chr#2Chr.21.17)).

joash_1633.name: Joash (the Abiezrite)
joash_1633.bio: The son and successor of Jehoahaz, king of Israel ([2 Kings 14:1](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.1); comp. 12:1; 13:10). When he ascended the throne the kingdom was suffering from the invasion of the Syrians.

joash_1636.name: Joash (son of Shemaah)
joash_1636.bio: One of the Benjamite archers who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:3](/1chr#1Chr.12.3)).

joash_1637.name: Joash (a king of Judah)
joash_1637.bio: One who had charge of the royal stores of oil under David and Solomon ([1 Chr. 27:28](/1chr#1Chr.27.28)).

job_1639.name: Job
job_1639.bio: Persecuted, an Arabian patriarch who resided in the land of Uz (q.v.). While living in the midst of great prosperity, he was suddenly overwhelmed by a series of sore trials that fell upon him. Amid all his sufferings he maintained his integrity.

jobab_1640.name: Jobab (son of Joktan)
jobab_1640.bio: One of the sons of Joktan, and founder of an Arabian tribe ([Gen. 10:29](/gen#Gen.10.29)).

jobab_1642.name: Jobab (king of Madon)
jobab_1642.bio: A Canaanitish king ([Josh. 11:1](/josh#Josh.11.1)) who joined the confederacy against Joshua.

jochebed_1645.name: Jochebed
jochebed_1645.bio: Jehovah is her glory, the wife of Amram, and the mother of Miriam, Aaron, and Moses ([Num. 26:59](/num#Num.26.59)). She is spoken of as the sister of Kohath, Amram’s father ([Ex.

joel_1647.name: Joel (A descendant of Reuben)
joel_1647.bio: The oldest of Samuel’s two sons appointed by him as judges in Beersheba ([1 Sam. 8:2](/1sam#1Sam.8.2)).

joel_1650.name: Joel (And Bela the son of Azaz)

joel_1653.name: Joel (son of Haggeri)
joel_1653.bio: One of David’s famous warriors ([1 Chr. 11:38](/1chr#1Chr.11.38)).

joel_1654.name: Joel (son of Pethuel)
joel_1654.bio: A Levite of the family of Gershom ([1 Chr. 15:7](/1chr#1Chr.15.7), [11](/1chr#1Chr.15.11)).

joel_1658.name: Joel (mentioned by name only once in the Hebre)

joel_1660.name: Joel (or Yahweh)
joel_1660.bio: Jehovah is his God. The second of the twelve minor prophets. He was the son of Pethuel.

joelah_1661.name: Joelah
joelah_1661.bio: A Benjamite who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:7](/1chr#1Chr.12.7)).

joezer_1662.name: Joezer
joezer_1662.bio: Jehovah is his help, one of the Korhites who became part of David’s body-guard ([1 Chr. 12:6](/1chr#1Chr.12.6)).

johanan_1666.name: Johanan (High Priest)
johanan_1666.bio: Son of Careah, one of the Jewish chiefs who rallied round Gedaliah, whom Nebuchadnezzar had made governor in Jerusalem ([2 Kings 25:23](/2kgs#2Kgs.25.23); [Jer. 40:8](/jer#Jer.40.8)). He warned Gedaliah of the plans of Ishmael against him, a warning which was unheeded ([Jer.

johanan_1667.name: Johanan (first-born son of Josiah)
johanan_1667.bio: The oldest of King Josiah’s sons ([1 Chr. 3:15](/1chr#1Chr.3.15)).

johanan_1671.name: Johanan (Israelite)
johanan_1671.bio: One of the Gadite heroes who joined David in the desert of Judah ([1 Chr. 12:12](/1chr#1Chr.12.12)).

john_1676.name: John (son of Zebedee)
john_1676.bio: the "forerunner of our Lord." We have but fragmentary and imperfect accounts of him in the Gospels. He was of priestly descent. His father, Zacharias, was a priest of the course of Abia ( 1 Chronicles 24:10 ), and his mother, Elisabeth, was of the daughters of Aaron ( Luke 1:5 ).

john_1677.name: John (Son of Zebedee)
john_1677.bio: THE APOSTLE, brother of James the "Greater" ( Matthew 4:21 ; 10:2 ; Mark 1:19 ; 3:17 ; 10:35 ). He was one, probably the younger, of the sons of Zebedee ( Matthew 4:21 ) and Salome ( Matthew 27:56 ; Compare Mark 15:40 ), and was born at Bethsaida. His father was apparently a man of some wealth (Compare Mark 1:20 ; Luke 5:3 ; John 19:27 ).

john_1678.name: John (’s clothes were made of camel’s hair)
john_1678.bio: One who, with Annas and Caiaphas, sat in judgment on the apostles Peter and John ( Acts 4:6 ). He was of the kindred of the high priest; otherwise unknown.

joiakim_1681.name: Joiakim
joiakim_1681.bio: (whom Jehovah has set up) = Jehoiakim, a high priest, the son and successor of Jeshua ([Neh. 12:10](/neh#Neh.12.10), [12](/neh#Neh.12.12), [26](/neh#Neh.12.26)).

joiarib_797.name: Joiarib (These were the leaders of the priests an)
joiarib_797.bio: The founder of one of the courses of the priests ([Neh. 11:10](/neh#Neh.11.10)).

joiarib_1682.name: Joiarib (Wise Man)
joiarib_1682.bio: [Ezra 8:16](/ezra#Ezra.8.16), a “man of understanding” whom Ezra sent to “bring ministers for the house of God.”

jokim_1684.name: Jokim
jokim_1684.bio: Whom Jehovah has set up, one of the descendants of Shelah ([1 Chr. 4:22](/1chr#1Chr.4.22)).

jokshan_1685.name: Jokshan
jokshan_1685.bio: Snarer, the second son of Abraham and Keturah ([Gen. 25:2](/gen#Gen.25.2), [3](/gen#Gen.25.3); [1 Chr. 1:32](/1chr#1Chr.1.32)).

joktan_1686.name: Joktan
joktan_1686.bio: Little, the second of the two sons of Eber ([Gen. 10:25](/gen#Gen.10.25); [1 Chr. 1:19](/1chr#1Chr.1.19)).

jonadab_799.name: Jonadab (Brother of David)
jonadab_799.bio: A son of Rechab, the founder of a tribe who bound themselves by a vow to abstain from wine ([Jer. 35:6-19](/jer#Jer.35.6)). There were different settlements of Rechabites ([Judg.

jonadab_1688.name: Jonadab (Amnon's adviser)
jonadab_1688.bio: Son of Shammah, and David’s nephew, and also one of his chief warriors ([2 Sam. 21:21](/2sam#2Sam.21.21)). He slew a giant in Gath.

jonah_1689.name: Jonah
jonah_1689.bio: A dove, the son of Amittai of Gath-hepher. He was a prophet of Israel, and predicted the restoration of the ancient boundaries ([2 Kings 14:25-27](/2kgs#2Kgs.14.25)) of the kingdom. He exercised his ministry very early in the reign of Jeroboam II., and thus was contemporary with Hosea and Amos; or possibly he preceded them, and consequently may have been the very oldest of all the prophets whose writings we possess.

jonas_1687.name: Jonas
jonas_1687.bio: The father of the apostles Peter ([John 21:15-17](/john#John.21.15)) and Andrew; but the reading should be (also in 1:42), as in the Revised Version, “John,” instead of Jonas.

jonathan_1691.name: Jonathan (Son of Gershom)
jonathan_1691.bio: A Levite descended from Gershom ([Judg. 18:30](/judg#Judg.18.30)). His history is recorded in 17:7-13 and 18:30.

jonathan_1692.name: Jonathan (who was at Gibeah in Benjamin)
jonathan_1692.bio: The eldest son of king Saul, and the bosom friend of David. He is first mentioned when he was about thirty years of age, some time after his father’s accession to the throne ([1 Sam. 13:2](/1sam#1Sam.13.2)).

jonathan_1693.name: Jonathan ((Hebrew: יְהוֹנָתָן Yəhōnāṯān or Yehonat)
jonathan_1693.bio: Son of the high priest Abiathar, and one who adhered to David at the time of Absalom’s rebellion ([2 Sam. 15:27](/2sam#2Sam.15.27), [36](/2sam#2Sam.15.36)). He is the last descendant of Eli of whom there is any record.

jonathan_1697.name: Jonathan (a heroic figure in 1 Samuel in the Hebre)

joram_804.name: Joram (Jehoshaphat king of Judah)
joram_804.bio: The son of Ahab and Jezebel, and successor to his brother Ahaziah on the throne of Israel. He reigned twelve years, B.C. 896-884 ([2 Kings 1:17](/2kgs#2Kgs.1.17); [3:1](/2kgs#2Kgs.3.1)).

joram_1705.name: Joram (he took gifts and a message from his fat)
joram_1705.bio: The son of Tou, king of Hamath, sent by his father to congratulate David on his victory over Hadarezer, king of Syria ([1 Chr. 18:10](/1chr#1Chr.18.10); called Joram [2 Sam. 8:10](/2sam#2Sam.8.10)).

josabad_1708.name: Josabad
josabad_1708.bio: One of the Benjamite archers who joined David at Ziklag ([1 Chr. 12:4](/1chr#1Chr.12.4)).

josedech_815.name: Josedech
josedech_815.bio: Jehovah-justified, the son of the high priest Seraiah at the time of the Babylonian exile ([1 Chr. 6:14](/1chr#1Chr.6.14), [15](/1chr#1Chr.6.15)). He was carried into captivity by Nebuchadnezzar, and probably died in Babylon.

joseph_1710.name: Joseph (The sons of Rachel)
joseph_1710.bio: remover or increaser. The elder of the two sons of Jacob by Rachel ( Genesis 30:23 Genesis 30:24 ), who, on the occasion of his birth, said, "God hath taken away [Heb. 'asaph] my reproach." "The Lord shall add [Heb.

joseph_1712.name: Joseph (son of Asaph)
joseph_1712.bio: One of the sons of Asaph, head of the first division of sacred musicians ([1 Chr. 25:2](/1chr#1Chr.25.2), [9](/1chr#1Chr.25.9)).

joseph_1715.name: Joseph (generation)
joseph_1715.bio: The foster-father of our Lord ([Matt. 1:16](/matt#Matt.1.16); [Luke 3:23](/luke#Luke.3.23)). He lived at Nazareth in Galilee ([Luke 2:4](/luke#Luke.2.4)).

joseph_1716.name: Joseph (disciple of Jesus)
joseph_1716.bio: A native of Arimathea, probably the Ramah of the Old Testament ([1 Sam. 1:19](/1sam#1Sam.1.19)), a man of wealth, and a member of the Sanhedrim ([Matt. 27:57](/matt#Matt.27.57); [Luke 23:50](/luke#Luke.23.50)), an “honourable counsellor, who waited for the kingdom of God.” As soon as he heard the tidings of Christ’s death, he “went in boldly” (lit.

joseph_1718.name: Joseph (Jacob said to Laban)
joseph_1718.bio: The son of Judah, and father of Semei ([Luke 3:26](/luke#Luke.3.26)). Other two of the same name in the ancestry of Christ are also mentioned (3:24, 30).

joshua_893.name: Joshua (Son of Jozadak)
joshua_893.bio: The son of Jozadak, and high priest of the Jews under Zerubbabel ([Neh. 7:7](/neh#Neh.7.7); [12:1](/neh#Neh.12.1), [7](/neh#Neh.12.7), [10](/neh#Neh.12.10), [26](/neh#Neh.12.26)); called Joshua ([Hag. 1:1](/hag#Hag.1.1), [12](/hag#Hag.1.12); [2:2](/hag#Hag.2.2), [4](/hag#Hag.2.4); [Zech.

joshua_1727.name: Joshua (Leader of the Israelite tribes)
joshua_1727.bio: Jehovah is his help, or Jehovah the Saviour. The son of Nun, of the tribe of Ephraim, the successor of Moses as the leader of Israel. He is called Jehoshua in Numbers 13:16 (A.V.), and Jesus in Acts 7:45 and Hebrews 4:8 (RSV, Joshua).

josiah_1730.name: Josiah (king of Israel)
josiah_1730.bio: Healed by Jehovah, or Jehovah will support. The son of Amon, and his successor on the throne of Judah ([2 Kings 22:1](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.1); [2 Chr. 34:1](/2chr#2Chr.34.1)).

josiah_1731.name: Josiah (son of King Amon)
josiah_1731.bio: Common in later times among the Jews in Palestine ([Matt. 23:37](/matt#Matt.23.37); [Luke 13:34](/luke#Luke.13.34)). It is noticeable that this familiar bird is only mentioned in these passages in connection with our Lord’s lamentation over the impenitence of Jerusalem.

jotham_1734.name: Jotham (son of jerobaal)
jotham_1734.bio: The youngest of Gideon’s seventy sons. He escaped when the rest were put to death by the order of Abimelech ([Judg. 9:5](/judg#Judg.9.5)).

jotham_1735.name: Jotham (King's son)
jotham_1735.bio: The son and successor of Uzziah on the throne of Judah. As during his last years Uzziah was excluded from public life on account of his leprosy, his son, then twenty-five years of age, administered for seven years the affairs of the kingdom in his father’s stead ([2 Chr. 26:21](/2chr#2Chr.26.21), [23](/2chr#2Chr.26.23); 27:1).

jozabad_1738.name: Jozabad (A chief of the tribe of Manasseh)

jozabad_1740.name: Jozabad (A chief Levite in the reign of Josiah.)

jubal_1748.name: Jubal
jubal_1748.bio: Jubilee, music, Lamech’s second son by Adah, of the line of Cain. He was the inventor of “the harp” (Heb. kinnor, properly “lyre”) and “the organ” (Heb.

jucal_822.name: Jucal
jucal_822.bio: Able, the son of Shelemiah. He is also called Jucal ([Jer. 38:1](/jer#Jer.38.1)).

juda_1750.name: Juda (the son of Joseph)
juda_1750.bio: The father of Simeon in Christ’s maternal ancestry ([Luke 3:30](/luke#Luke.3.30)).

judah_1751.name: Judah (Now will I praise [Heb. odeh] Jehovah)
judah_1751.bio: Praise, the fourth son of Jacob by Leah. The name originated in Leah’s words of praise to the Lord on account of his birth: “Now will I praise [Heb. odeh] Jehovah, and she called his name Yehudah” ([Gen.

judah_1755.name: Judah (the fourth son of the patriarch Jacob an)

judas_1757.name: Judas (Iscariot was one of the 12 apostles who)

judas_1758.name: Judas (Tarsus named Saul)
judas_1758.bio: A Jew of Damascus ( Acts 9:11 ), to whose house Ananias was sent. The street called "Straight" in which it was situated is identified with the modern "street of bazaars," where is still pointed out the so-called "house of Judas."

judas_1759.name: Judas (the Betrayer of Christ)
judas_1759.bio: A Christian teacher, surnamed Barsabas. He was sent from Jerusalem to Antioch along with Paul and Barnabas with the decision of the council ( Acts 15:22 Acts 15:27 Acts 15:32 ). He was a "prophet" and a "chief man among the brethren."

judas_1760.name: Judas (The apostle of Christ)
judas_1760.bio: Son of Simon ( John 6:71 ; John 13:2 John 13:26 ), surnamed Iscariot, i.e., a man of Kerioth ( Joshua 15:25 ). His name is uniformly the last in the list of the apostles, as given in the synoptic (i.e., the first three) Gospels. The evil of his nature probably gradually unfolded itself till "Satan entered into him" ( John 13:27 ), and he betrayed our Lord ( 18:3 ).

jude_1756.name: Jude
jude_1756.bio: '= Judas. Among the apostles there were two who bore this name, (1) Judas ([Jude 1](/jude#Jude.1.1):1; [Matt. 13:55](/matt#Matt.13.55); [John 14:22](/john#John.14.22); [Acts 1:13](/acts#Acts.1.13)), called also Lebbaeus or Thaddaeus ([Matt.

julia_1762.name: Julia
julia_1762.bio: A Christian woman at Rome to whom Paul sent his salutations ([Rom. 16:15](/rom#Rom.16.15)), supposed to be the wife of Philologus.

julius_1763.name: Julius
julius_1763.bio: the centurion of the Augustan cohort, or the emperor's body-guard, in whose charge Paul was sent prisoner to Rome ( Acts 27:1 Acts 27:3 Acts 27:43 ). He entreated Paul "courteously," showing in many ways a friendly regard for him.

junia_1764.name: Junia
junia_1764.bio: ([Rom. 16:7](/rom#Rom.16.7)), a Christian at Rome to whom Paul sends salutations along with Andronicus.

justus_1766.name: Justus
justus_1766.bio: A Jewish proselyte at Corinth, in whose house, next door to the synagogue, Paul held meetings and preached after he left the synagogue ( Acts 18:7 ).
